intro: Alsine verna var. ramosissima, commonly known as slender alsike clover, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing annual herb with hairy stems and small, pea-like flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
